New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers became the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them.
The Cavaliers set a franchise record with a 41-point halftime lead at 83-42.
Key Match Events: Cleveland had a 20-2 lead early on, with Garland making two 3-pointers and Mobley scoring six points.
Golden State missed eight of its first nine field goal attempts and Green picked up two fouls in the first 5:39.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The matchup was the 21st time in NBA history that a team with an undefeated road record played an unbeaten home team, minimum four games for each.
